Action
Base class for Actions.
ActionList
A thin wrapper for java.util.ArrayList<Action> that does not allow nulls to be added.
Actor
The Actor class represents a GameEntity that can perform an Action.

An interface that represents an attribute of an actor.

ActorLocationsIterator
Represents a bimap of locations and actors.
AffectedByWeather
The AffectedByWeather interface defines methods that entities can implement to specify modifications that occur when affected by different weather conditions.

Application
The main class to start the game.

FocusAction
A class representing the 'Focus' action, the special skill of Broadsword.
FocusActionCapable
An interface representing items or objects capable of focus actions, which allow the adjustment of weapon statistics such as damage multiplier and hit rate.
FollowBehaviour
A class that figures out a MoveAction that will move the actor one step closer to a target Actor.
FollowBehaviour
A behavior class representing the behavior of an actor following a target actor.

A class representing a Forest Keeper enemy actor in the game.

Base class for all objects that can exist in the game.
GameMap
Class representing one map within the system.

Class representing a gate on the game map.

Graveyard
Class representing a graveyard ground on the game map, where enemies can spawn.

A class representing a Great Knife weapon item in the game.

GroundFactory
Interface for factory classes used by GameMap to create new map locations.

Represents a Healing Vial item in the game, which is consumable, purchasable, and sellable.

Class representing a puddle ground on the game map.

Runes
Represents a Runes item in the game, which is consumable and can be used to increase an actor's balance.

Class representing the Void, a bottomless pit, on the game map that kills actors when stepped on.

Class representing a wall ground on the game map that blocks actor movement.

Weather
 
WeatherManager
The WeatherManager class manages the current weather conditions in the game and applies weather-related effects to entities affected by weather changes.

World
Za Warudo! - DIO Class representing the game world, including the locations of all Actors, the player, and the playing grid.
